supports_group_request.description: Indicates if group requests are supported

supports_timescale_marks.description: Indicates if timescale marks are supported

has_weekly_and_monthly.description: Array of weekly and monthly indicators

bar_fillgaps.description: Array of bar fill gaps indicators

exchange.description: Exchange where the symbol is listed

has_intraday.description: Indicates if intraday data is available

has_daily.description: Indicates if daily data is available

has_weekly_and_monthly.description: Indicates if weekly and monthly data is available

ticker_id.description: Identifier of a ticker with delimiter to separate base/target, eg. BTC_ETH (Contract address for DEX)

base_currency.description: Symbol/Currency code/Contract Address of a the base cryptoasset, eg. BTC (Contract address for DEX)

target_currency.description: Symbol/Currency code/Contract Address of the target cryptoasset, eg. ETH (Contract address for DEX)

pool_id.description: Pool/pair address or unique ID (Mandatory for DEX)

last_price.description: Last transacted price of base currency based on given target currency. eg. X = ? 1 base = X target

base_volume.description: 24 hour trading volume for the pair (unit in base)

target_volume.description: 24 hour trading volume for the pair (unit in target)

liquidity_in_usd.description: Pool liquidity in USD (Not applicable to orderbook DEXes)

ticker_id.description: A pair such as "BTC_ETH", with delimiter between different cryptoassets

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds for when the last updated time occurred

bids.description: An array containing 2 elements. The offer price and quantity for each bid order

asks.description: An array containing 2 elements. The ask price and quantity for each ask order

trade_id.description: A unique ID associated with the trade for the currency pair transaction. Note: Unix timestamp does not qualify as trade_id.

price.description: Transaction price of base asset in target currency

base_volume.description: Transaction amount in base pair volume

target_volume.description: Transaction amount in target pair volume

trade_timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds for when the transaction occurred

type.description: Used to determine the type of the transaction that was completed. Buy  Identifies an ask that was removed from the order book. Sell  Identifies a bid that was removed from the order book.

get.description: Request for config data.

200.description: TradingView datafeed configuration data is retrieved

get.description:
Request for history bars. Each property of the response object is treated as a table column. 

Data follows these requirements:

- real-time data obtained from the API streaming endpoint must match the historical data, obtained from the /history API. The allowed count of mismatched bars (candles) must not exceed 5% for frequently traded symbols, otherwise the integration to TradingView is not possible;
- the data must not include unreasonable price gaps, historical data gaps on 1-minute and Daily-resolutions (temporal gaps), obviously incorrect prices (adhesions).

If there is no data in the requested time period, endpoint returns an empty response: `{"s":"ok","t":[],"o":[],"h":[],"l":[],"c":[],"v":[]}`

metadata.description: Symbol name or ticker. This is case-insensitive.

Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are 1, 2, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, D, 1D, W, 1W, M, 1M. D, W, M are aliases for 1D, 1W, 1M correspondingly. D and 1D mean the same and equal to 1 day. 1W means 1 week. 1M means 1 month.
Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including from.
Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including to. It can be in the future. In this case, the rightmost required bar is the latest available bar.

schema.description: Symbol name or ticker. This is case-insensitive.

Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are 1, 2, 5, 15, 30, 60, 120, 240, 360, 720, D, 1D, W, 1W, M, 1M. D, W, M are aliases for 1D, 1W, 1M correspondingly. D and 1D mean the same and equal to 1 day. 1W means 1 week. 1M means 1 month.
Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including from.
Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including to. It can be in the future. In this case, the rightmost required bar is the latest available bar.

422.description: TradingView history data is not retrieved with error

get.description: Show all groups to be displayed in Tradingview in Standard
Request for streaming data. `f` is always "t" and `s` is always 0.
Get a list of all instruments.

schema.description: ID of a symbol group. If it is present then only symbols that belong to this group should be returned. Possible values are provided by the /groups endpoint.

422.description: TradingView history data is not retrieved with error

get.description: Request for symbol search data.

schema.description: Text typed by the user in the Symbol Search edit box.
Type of the requested symbol. If no type is provided, all types should be returned. Possible values are provided by the /groups endpoint.
Exchange name of the requested symbol. Default value is PYTH.
The maximum number of symbols in a response. Default value is 15.

200.description: TradingView symbol search data is retrieved

422.description: TradingView symbol search data is not retrieved with error

get.description: Request for symbol resolution data.

schema.description: Symbol name or ticker. This is case-insensitive.

422.description: TradingView history data is not retrieved with error

get.description: Get Market related statistics for all markets for the last 24 hours
Get Order book depth of any given trading pair, split into two different arrays for bid and ask orders

schema.description: A ticker such as "BTC_ETH", with delimiter between different cryptoassets

Orders depth quantity: [0, 100, 200, 500...]. 0 returns full depth. Depth = 100 means 50 for each bid/ask side. Note that for more liquid or closely priced pairs, the lack of order depth may result in miscalculation of depth/spread.

get.description: Get Historical trade data for any given trading pair

schema.description: A pair such as "BTC_ETH", with delimiter between different cryptoassets
To indicate nature of trade - buy/sell
Number of historical trades to retrieve from time of query. [0, 200, 500...]. 0 returns full history.
Start time from which to query historical trades from
End time for historical trades query

get.description: Check if the websocket connection is saturated within the server
